docs.lead_paragraph: The child was born over the weekend to Robyn Benson in Victoria, British Columbia, after she was declared brain-dead because of a cerebral hemorrhage.

headline.main: Canada: Healthy Baby Is Delivered by Woman Declared Brain-Dead
headline.print_headline: Canada: Healthy Baby Is Delivered by Woman Declared Brain-Dead

docs.abstract: Robyn Benson, pregnant Canadian woman who was legally declared brain-dead after cerebral hemorrhage on December 28, gives birth to healthy baby; Benson is removed from life support at request of her family after the birth.
docs.snippet: The child was born over the weekend to Robyn Benson in Victoria, British Columbia, after she was declared brain-dead because of a cerebral hemorrhage.

docs.lead_paragraph: A woman accused of kidnapping her 5-day-old nephew and leaving him outside an Iowa gas station as police closed in on her has a long criminal history with frequent moves and multiple names, but nothing in her past indicates why she might have taken a child.

headline.main: Woman Accused of Taking Nephew Has Criminal Past
headline.print_headline: Woman Accused of Taking Nephew Has Criminal Past

docs.abstract: When “as such” is used correctly, with a clear antecedent, you should be able to substitute that antecedent for “such” and have the sentence make sense. But we frequently misuse “as such” in a much looser way to connect two thoughts. If there’s no clear noun antecedent for “such,” think again and rephrase.

docs.lead_paragraph: Syrian authorities have detained 336 men who left Homs and are still questioning most of them without direct supervision by any neutral third party, the United Nations said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Syrian Authorities Question Over 300 Men From Besieged Homs-U.N.
headline.print_headline: Syrian Authorities Question Over 300 Men From Besieged Homs-U.N.

docs.lead_paragraph: A 21-year-old woman arrested for investigation of drunk driving and manslaughter after a crash that killed six people had her license suspended as a teenager for driving under the influence, according to state Department of Motor Vehicle records.

headline.main: Driver Arrested in Deadly Crash Had Previous DUI
headline.print_headline: Driver Arrested in Deadly Crash Had Previous DUI

docs.snippet: A 21-year-old woman arrested for investigation of drunk driving and manslaughter after a crash that killed six people had her license suspended as a teenager for driving under the influence, according to state Department of Motor Vehicle records.

docs.lead_paragraph: Recent developments in health and science news. This week: A deadly bird flu in China causes alarm and researchers suggest revising guideline on intervention during labor.

headline.main: Debating Evolution and Dealing With Climate Change
headline.print_headline: Debating Evolution and Dealing With Climate Change

docs.abstract: The Week column; experts say that new and more lethal strain of avian influenza, known as H7N9, is surging through China and has infected 300 people, a quarter of whom have died; other significant news in medicine and science highlighted.
docs.snippet: Recent developments in health and science news. This week: A deadly bird flu in China causes alarm and researchers suggest revising guideline on intervention during labor.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Feb. 10 about the abduction of a Wisconsin infant, The Associated Press erroneously reported that the child was taken from his mother's home. Kayden Powell was abducted from his great-grandmother's home, where he and his mother were staying.

docs.lead_paragraph: The mother of a newborn was hospitalized Monday and facing possible manslaughter charges after authorities say she drunkenly drove the wrong way on a Southern California freeway, slamming into another car and killing six people, including her own sister.
